trans-unit.source: About the virtual machine agent and extensions
trans-unit.target: About the virtual machine agent and extensions

trans-unit.source: The Azure Virtual Machine Agent (VM Agent) is used to install, configure, manage and run Azure Virtual Machine Extensions (VM Extensions).
trans-unit.target: The Azure Virtual Machine Agent (VM Agent) is used to install, configure, manage and run Azure Virtual Machine Extensions (VM Extensions).

trans-unit.source: VM Extensions provide dynamic features that Microsoft and other third parties provide.
trans-unit.target: VM Extensions provide dynamic features that Microsoft and other third parties provide.

trans-unit.source: The agent and extensions are added primarily through the Management Portal, but you can also use the [Powershell](../install-configure-powershell.md) cmdlets or the [xplat-cli](virtual-machines-command-line-tools.md) to add and configure either when you create a VM or with existing VMs.
trans-unit.target: The agent and extensions are added primarily through the Management Portal, but you can also use the [Powershell](../install-configure-powershell.md) cmdlets or the [xplat-cli](virtual-machines-command-line-tools.md) to add and configure either when you create a VM or with existing VMs.

trans-unit.source: VM Extensions include support for [Remote Debugging in Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/y7f5zaaa.aspx), [System Center 2012](http://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/18274.system-center-2012-r2-virtual-machine-role-authoring-guide-resource-extension-package.aspx), [Microsoft Azure Diagnostics](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/09/02/windows-azure-virtual-machine-monitoring-with-wad-extension/), and [Docker](virtual-machines-docker-vm-extension.md) -- just to name a few.
trans-unit.target: VM Extensions include support for [Remote Debugging in Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/y7f5zaaa.aspx), [System Center 2012](http://social.technet.microsoft.com/wiki/contents/articles/18274.system-center-2012-r2-virtual-machine-role-authoring-guide-resource-extension-package.aspx), [Microsoft Azure Diagnostics](http://azure.microsoft.com/blog/2014/09/02/windows-azure-virtual-machine-monitoring-with-wad-extension/), and [Docker](virtual-machines-docker-vm-extension.md) -- just to name a few.

trans-unit.source: VM extensions can help you:
trans-unit.target: VM extensions can help you:

trans-unit.source: Modify security and identity features, such as resetting account values and using antimalware
trans-unit.target: Modify security and identity features, such as resetting account values and using antimalware

trans-unit.source: Start, stop, or configure monitoring and diagnostics
trans-unit.target: Start, stop, or configure monitoring and diagnostics

trans-unit.source: Reset or install connectivity features, such as RDP and SSH
trans-unit.target: Reset or install connectivity features, such as RDP and SSH

trans-unit.source: Diagnose, monitor, and manage your VMs
trans-unit.target: Diagnose, monitor, and manage your VMs

trans-unit.source: There are many other features as well; new VM Extension features are released regularly.
trans-unit.target: There are many other features as well; new VM Extension features are released regularly.

trans-unit.source: This article describes the Azure VM Agents for Windows and Linux, and how they support VM Extension functionality.
trans-unit.target: This article describes the Azure VM Agents for Windows and Linux, and how they support VM Extension functionality.

trans-unit.source: For a listing of VM Extensions by feature category, see [Azure VM Extensions and Features](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn606311.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For a listing of VM Extensions by feature category, see [Azure VM Extensions and Features](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn606311.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Azure VM Agents for Windows and Linux
trans-unit.target: Azure VM Agents for Windows and Linux

trans-unit.source: The Azure Virtual Machines Agent (VM Agent) is a secured, light-weight process that installs, configures, and removes VM extensions on instances of Azure Virtual Machines from the Image Gallery and on custom VM instances if they have the VM Agent installed.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Virtual Machines Agent (VM Agent) is a secured, light-weight process that installs, configures, and removes VM extensions on instances of Azure Virtual Machines from the Image Gallery and on custom VM instances if they have the VM Agent installed.

trans-unit.source: The VM Agent acts as the secure local control service for your Azure VM.
trans-unit.target: The VM Agent acts as the secure local control service for your Azure VM.

trans-unit.source: The extensions that the agent loads provide specific features to increase your productivity using the instance.
trans-unit.target: The extensions that the agent loads provide specific features to increase your productivity using the instance.

trans-unit.source: There are two Azure VM Agents, one for Windows VMs and one for Linux VMs.
trans-unit.target: There are two Azure VM Agents, one for Windows VMs and one for Linux VMs.

trans-unit.source: By default, the VM Agent is automatically installed when you create a VM from the Image Gallery, but you can also install the VM agent after the instance is created or install it in a custom VM image that you then upload yourself.
trans-unit.target: By default, the VM Agent is automatically installed when you create a VM from the Image Gallery, but you can also install the VM agent after the instance is created or install it in a custom VM image that you then upload yourself.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] These VM agents are very light-weight, services that enable secured administration of virtual machine instances.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] These VM agents are very light-weight, services that enable secured administration of virtual machine instances.

trans-unit.source: There might be cases in which you do not want the VM Agent.
trans-unit.target: There might be cases in which you do not want the VM Agent.

trans-unit.source: If so, be sure to create VMs that do not have the VM Agent installed.
trans-unit.target: If so, be sure to create VMs that do not have the VM Agent installed.

trans-unit.source: Although the VM Agent can be removed physically, the behavior of any VM Extensions on the instance is undefined.
trans-unit.target: Although the VM Agent can be removed physically, the behavior of any VM Extensions on the instance is undefined.

trans-unit.source: As a result, removing the VM agent once it is installed is not supported at this time.
trans-unit.target: As a result, removing the VM agent once it is installed is not supported at this time.

trans-unit.source: The VM Agent is enabled in the following situations:
trans-unit.target: The VM Agent is enabled in the following situations:

trans-unit.source: When you create an instance of a Virtual Machine by using the **Quick Create** method in the Management Portal, or by using the **Custom Create** method in the Management Portal and making sure that the **Install the VM Agent** checkbox is selected (as shown in the image below).
trans-unit.target: When you create an instance of a Virtual Machine by using the **Quick Create** method in the Management Portal, or by using the **Custom Create** method in the Management Portal and making sure that the **Install the VM Agent** checkbox is selected (as shown in the image below).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Create a Custom Virtual Machine](virtual-machines-create-custom.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Create a Custom Virtual Machine](virtual-machines-create-custom.md).

trans-unit.source: VM Agent Checkbox
trans-unit.target: VM Agent Checkbox

trans-unit.source: When you create an instance of a Virtual Machine by using the [New-AzureVM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495254.aspx) or the [New-AzureQuickVM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495183.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: When you create an instance of a Virtual Machine by using the [New-AzureVM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495254.aspx) or the [New-AzureQuickVM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495183.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: You can create a VM without the VM Agent installed by adding the **–DisableGuestAgent** parameter to the [Add-AzureProvisioningConfig](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495299.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: You can create a VM without the VM Agent installed by adding the **–DisableGuestAgent** parameter to the [Add-AzureProvisioningConfig](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn495299.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: By manually downloading and installing the VM Agent (either the Windows or Linux version) on an existing VM instance and then setting the **ProvisionGuestAgent** value to **true** using Powershell or a REST call.
trans-unit.target: By manually downloading and installing the VM Agent (either the Windows or Linux version) on an existing VM instance and then setting the **ProvisionGuestAgent** value to **true** using Powershell or a REST call.

trans-unit.source: By creating a VM image that has the VM agent installed prior to uploading it to Azure.
trans-unit.target: By creating a VM image that has the VM agent installed prior to uploading it to Azure.

trans-unit.source: For a Windows VM, download the [Windows VM Agent .msi file](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=394789&clcid=0x409) and install the VM Agent.
trans-unit.target: For a Windows VM, download the [Windows VM Agent .msi file](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=394789&clcid=0x409) and install the VM Agent.

trans-unit.source: For a Linux VM, you will install it from the located at <https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent>.
trans-unit.target: For a Linux VM, you will install it from the located at <https://github.com/Azure/WALinuxAgent>.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how to install the VM Agent on Linux, see the [Azure Linux VM Agent User Guide](virtual-machines-linux-agent-user-guide.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on how to install the VM Agent on Linux, see the [Azure Linux VM Agent User Guide](virtual-machines-linux-agent-user-guide.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]In PaaS, the VM agent is called **GuestAgent**, and is always available on Web and Worker Role VMs.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]In PaaS, the VM agent is called **GuestAgent**, and is always available on Web and Worker Role VMs.

trans-unit.source: (For more information, see [Azure Role Architecture](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kwill/archive/2011/05/05/windows-azure-role-architecture.aspx).) The VM agent for Role VMs can now add extensions to the cloud service VMs in the same way that it does for persistent Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: (For more information, see [Azure Role Architecture](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/kwill/archive/2011/05/05/windows-azure-role-architecture.aspx).) The VM agent for Role VMs can now add extensions to the cloud service VMs in the same way that it does for persistent Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: The biggest difference between VM Extensions on role VMs and persistent VMs is that with role VMs, extensions are added to the cloud service first and then to the deployments within that cloud service.
trans-unit.target: The biggest difference between VM Extensions on role VMs and persistent VMs is that with role VMs, extensions are added to the cloud service first and then to the deployments within that cloud service.
